Difficulty Notes: Easy optimization problem with intuitive solution
Question: Considering that it is the blue players turn, and the player rolls the dice summing to 6. What is the maximum number of points that the blue player can earn by the end of this turn. Report the answer in the following manner: [points_before_turn = <the number of points before the current turn>, points_after_turn = <the number of points after the turn is complete>].
Rationale: In the given game state the blue player has 1 city and 1 settlement giving a total of 3 points before the start of the turn. The blue player currently has: 1 grain, 1 brick, and 1 lumber resource cards. And one knight development card in hand, and one knight in the table. The way in which the player can earn the maximum number of points is: The player rolls 6, so since the player has a city in 6, gains two ore resource making the total resource pool: 1 grain, 0 wool, 1 brick, 1 lumber, 2 ore. In order to build a road we need: (1 of each lumber, brick). With this the blue player can build a road at the intersection of (5, 8) or (6, 5) in order to make the longest road. This would result in the player gaining 2 more points as the settlement placed breaks the longest road, resulting in blue player getting the longest road card. Therefore the blue player would gain 2 more points by the end of this round.
